result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Order to Withdraw

4:00 PM Defendant Waherr Vang in court.  Attorney Richard Louis Yonko in court for Waherr Vang.  Prosecuting attorney David Schneck in court for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter Snowden Her in person. V. Girard - Clerk 
Interpreter Her sworn in
Atty Yonko - there is no agreement as of today - informed deft of withdrawing as attorney 
Court asks if he knows how to contact PD
Atty Yonko - believes will be communication barriers, believes new atty would have to meet here in person to have Mr Her assist - will contact PD's office to assist this
Court - bond cont
Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 23, 2023 at 10:15 am.
Pre-trial conference on January 23, 2023 at 10:15 am.

off record Court calls PD's office
Back on the record

11:15 am  case recalled with Atty. Lundeen now present in the courtroom with all other parties still present
